thread.title: Gourmet grilled cheese and burger joint The Meating Room to open in Levenshulme
thread.title_full: Gourmet grilled cheese and burger joint The Meating Room to open in Levenshulme

author: Lucy Lovell
title: Gourmet grilled cheese and burger joint The Meating Room to open in Levenshulme
text:
Gourmet grilled cheese and burger joint The Meating Room to open in Levenshulme The Meating Room wants to beef up the suburb's independent restaurant scene Share Get What's On updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Levenshulme is set to get a taste of gourmet comfort food with the launch of grilled cheese and burger restaurant, The Meating Room. 
Set under the verandas at 948 Stockport Road, the all-day diner aims to open next month with a menu of handmade products using quality ingredients. 
Owner Umar Raja - who is running the project with his wife Amna - says: "It's all going to be made when you order it – not pre-made, in a relaxing atmosphere where you can come and chill out and enjoy food with a proper coffee." 
The restaurant will look different to anything currently in Levenshulme, says Raja, who is basing his designs on trendy London diners such as BIRD, the free-range fried chicken joint similar to Yard and Coop in the Northern Quarter. 
"We've done it up with the unfinished industrial kind of look – urban hipster kind of vibes," he adds. Umar and Amna Raja outside their new unit The Meating Room 
The 25-seater restaurant will not have a bar, instead diners can choose from a range of alcohol-free cocktails and Raja may implement a BYOB policy in the future. 
The menu - which is available from breakfast right through until the evening - will be priced from around £5-6 per dish, with sides and extras costing a little more. Read More Is this the hottest burger in Manchester? Hard Rock Cafe launches fiery special for National Chilli Day Yard and Coop on Edge Street in the Northern Quarter (Photo: Jen Urwin) 
Independents such as Trove and more recently The Buttery have led the food and drink scene in the area, and now Raja - who has lived in the area all his life - hopes to pave the way for even more restaurants. 
He adds: "Levy is up and coming now. It might give other people the motivation to try something different if this works." 
"It has changed a lot; you get a lot more nice and professional people moving here. Maybe a few more nice eating places and bars will bring more nice people here." 
This is the first food venture for Raja, who is testing the water by offering a series of free tasting sessions in the coming weeks. Visitors can snap up samples of the menu, including gourmet cheese toasties and burgers in exchange for offering some feedback. 
Opening dates for The Meating Room are still to be confirmed; check back on @CityLifeManc for more information on the launch. Read More
